Detailed Description

A very simple packet pool.

Currently only handles one size of the packets. The packet pool uses monitors to make it threadsafe.

Definition at line 25 of file PacketPool.h.

Member Function Documentation

uint32 PacketPool::getCurNbrPackets (   ) 
 

Please note that this is mainly for debugging -- this method takes linear time!

Returns:
The number of packet currently in this packet pool

Packet* PacketPool::getPacket (   ) 
 

Used to get a free packet.

If no free packet in the pool, a new is created and returned. Should replace "new".

Returns:
A free packet, with the size specified when the packetpool created.

void PacketPool::returnPacket (  Packet *  p  ) 
 

Returns a packet to the PacketPool.

Should replace "delete".

Parameters:
p The packet to return.
